title: rt.representation theory - Abelian ideals of $\mathfrak{n}_+$
body: Let $g$ be a finite dimensional simple Lie algebra. Then we have the root space decomposition $$ g=\mathfrak{h}\oplus \mathfrak{n}_+ \oplus \mathfrak{n}_-. $$ My question: how to classify the abelian ideals of $\mathfrak{n}_+$ that are closed under $\mathfrak h$ -action? rt.representation-theory lie-algebras Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jul 11, 2020 at 9:18 YCor 67.5k 5 5 gold badges 203 203 silver badges 301 301 bronze badges asked Jul 11, 2020 at 7:16 Xuan 11 1 1 bronze badge $\endgroup$ 2 3 $\begingroup$ This can be translated into a combinatorial problem as follows. Being $\mathfrak{h}$-submodules, these are graded submodules of $\mathfrak{n}_+$, hence given by a subset $F$ of the set of positive roots $\Phi_+$ (in particular, there are finitely many). The condition of being abelian means that $x+y\notin\Phi_+$ for all $x,y\in F$. The condition of being an ideal of $\mathfrak{n}_+$ means that if $x\in\Phi_+$ and $y\in F$ and $x+y\in\Phi_+$ then $x+y\in F$. $\endgroup$ YCor –  YCor 2020-07-11 09:15:32 +00:00 Commented Jul 11, 2020 at 9:15 $\begingroup$ (I assumed a split semisimple Lie algebra in char 0, e.g., complex simple) $\endgroup$ YCor –  YCor 2020-07-11 09:18:20 +00:00 Commented Jul 11, 2020 at 9:18 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
